Cultural differences: Participants from different cultures may have different values, beliefs, and communication styles, which can lead to misunderstandings and conflicts.
Political tensions: Participants from countries with political tensions or conflicts may have difficulty working together and may be resistant to compromise.
Time zone differences: Participants from different countries may be in different time zones, making it difficult to schedule meetings and coordinate activities.
Security concerns: Participants from countries with political tensions or conflicts may have security concerns, making it difficult to ensure the safety of all participants.
Financial constraints: Organizing an international peace summit can be expensive, and participants from different countries may have different financial resources.
